headline: Estée Lauder (EL) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of beauty products company Estée Lauder (NYSE:EL) jumped 3.2% in the morning session after the release of a favorable Consumer Price Index (CPI) report showed inflation cooling more than anticipated. The July report from the Bureau of Labor Statistics indicated a year-over-year inflation rate of 2.7%, just below the 2.8% economists had forecast. summary: The Estee Lauder Companies' fiscal fourth-quarter results are likely to reflect a decline due to challenges in China, travel retail and rising expenses.

headline: Saudi Arabia Halal Cosmetics Market Outlook and Company Analysis Report 2025-2033 Featuring Estee Lauder, L'Oreal, S&J, Kao, Clara International, Inika, Amara, Wardah, Sampure, Halal Cosmetics Co
summary: The Saudi Arabia halal cosmetics market is set to reach US$ 11.16 billion by 2033, growing from US$ 3.57 billion in 2024 at a 13.5% CAGR. Key growth drivers include increased religious observance, demand for ethical, chemical-free products, and government support under Vision 2030. Rising female purchasing power, social media influence, and e-commerce accessibility further propel market expansion. Challenges like stringent certification processes and price sensitivity remain. headline: India's Nykaa posts two-fold rise in quarterly profit on beauty products demand
summary: The company, which retails an array of brands such as Estee Lauder and actor Katrina Kaif's Kay Beauty both online and offline, said profit rose to 233.2 million rupees ($2.66 million) for the first quarter ended June 30, from 96.4 million rupees a year ago.  Indians, especially the affluent, have not shied away from spending on skincare and cosmetics — a category that outperforms others even during a consumption slowdown — helping prop up the $28-billion beauty and personal care industry in India.  Nykaa added brands such as luxury offering Chanel, Korean skincare label Aestura and sunscreen maker Supergoop to its product line-up, lifting revenue in its beauty business 24% to 19.75 billion rupees.
